intro: Erigeron condensatus, commonly known as the denseblue fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its small, blue to purple flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Erigeron condensatus is often found in disturbed areas and can be a common sight in arid environments.
